As of right now (9:15pm PST on Friday), Radio Integrated is on the air!
Listen at http://www.zer01.net:1200/

Right now we're playing some techno tunes as selected by Chelsea Faith....
Perla will be rocking your socks coming up at 9:30, so get tuned in!

More info below ----->

Love Chelsea


*************************************************************

This week /// 15 February, 2008 /// 9pm-1am Pacific Standard Time ///
http://www.zer01.net:1200/

it's SUCKA FREE techno night with the sounds of::

->DJ Alex Windsor

Originally from London, Alex has been instrumental in the San Francisco
Techno (with a capital T) scene since 1992 as a partner in the Gaia Mantra
Record store in SF and as a promoter and resident of techno weekly MAD
Mondays in the mid 90s. Alex's skills have taken him all across the globe,
from the US to Japan and the UK. He has played alongside the likes of Aphex
Twin, the Shamen, Orbital, Carl Craig, Richie Hawtin, Moby, Mr.C, Juan
Atkins, Mark Broom, & Dave Clarke just to name a few.... He's played at
parties here in SF run by such infamous crews as Friends & Family, Harmony,
Area 51, Tribal Future, Gateway, Brass Tax , Future, and countless
undergrounds and one-offs.

->DJ Perla
http://www.myspace.com/perladanceusted

Perla has appeared on Radio Integrated before and totally rocked it with his
own live material. Perla originally hails from Southern Spain, where he
helped promote his Dance Usted parties or, 'Dance Please'.  As bulletproof
and flawless as his original tracks are, his selection skills are equally
unbeatable. We are pleased to welcome Perla back this time for a special
Ableton Live DJ Set.


Tune in at :
http://www.zer01.net:1200/

Every Friday from 9pm - 1AM PST

Contact : radiointegrated@gmail.com


Upcoming Radio Integrated shows ///

*22 February//  Taking a little break from the techno (gasp!) to bring you
ILL-Ectro night featuring DJs Indigo and Sheztek, dropping all electro sets.
Note: 'Doing the robot' is forbidden... unless you're calling it 'locking
and poppin', then it's OK.

*29 February// Broadcasting live from brand new techno weekly Faktion at Anu
in San Francisco, with DJ Developer (Los Angeles) and local SF deep techno
producer Endosine (Live P.A.) Come in and have a drink with us at Anu if
you're in town, otherwise tune in to Radio Integrated and be there in
spirit. ;)

*7 March//  Keeping it real with DJs Clarity and Caltrop. Clarity is a
longtime SF techno favorite who played some records at the very first DEF
event, and we are stoked to welcome her back. A former resident of SF
electro club Tokyo Electric, Caltrop is an eclectic and creative DJ who
always keeps it groovin' with his mix of minimal, electro, house, disco,
acid, from the old school to the new school.

Check it out!


For updates on Radio Integrated, DEF, and San Francisco Bay Area techno news
and info, sign up for the DEF list at
def-announce-subscribe@defsf.com<def-announce-unsubscribe@defsf.com>


///Radio Integrated :: radiointegrated@gmail.com ::
http://www.zer01.net:1200/ :: Broadcasting live from Bliss Factory Studios,
Alameda, CA///

Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: Quiting Smoking (cigarettes)

That's how a friend of mine quit smoking.  His epiphany was not about  
his smoking, but about his weight.  After his father had a heart  
attack, he realized he was seriously overweight too and possibly  
headed towards a coronary himself.  So he decided to get in shape.   
And the goal he set for himself was to be able to run a marathon (not  
necessarily competitively, just to be able to do it).

Smoking was interfering with his running, so one day he just decided  
that the running was more important to him; and he quit... cold  
turkey... and never smoked again, not even pot.


cya,
john

Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: Quiting Smoking (cigarettes)

>From another list:

[Beat Randy to the punch.] Its not as hard as it used to be for
peeps to quit cigarettes these days given the treatments out there.
Both my sister and my wife quit successfully doing the following:

Month One: Day One - Start Wellbutrin regimin, continue to smoke
Month One: Day 15 - Start wearing nicotine patch, continue to smoke
Month Two Day 1 - Quit smoking
Month Two Day 15 - Quit patch
Month Three Day 1 - Quit Wellbutrin

The ramp off the patch and the medicine can happen faster or more
slowly as required. Both said the combo really reduced the
withdrawals symptoms. My proof came when my wife successfully quit
and we didn't have a single argument the following 2 weeks (which
ALWAYS happened when she had unsuccessfully tried to quit prior.)

James E



--

KZSU Radio or Stanford University." (or words to that effect.)

> So this thing has been languishing on my hard drive since last August. I
> recently resurrected it from an old backup, and thought it was pretty
> cool so I'm sharing it with you. Fair warning: this ain't no dance mix.
> It's much better suited for zoning out at work, smoking something
> illicit, recovering from a nasty hangover, or making out.
>=20
> The title refers to the fact that this is--by far--the slowest mix I've
> ever done. I just hit record one day when I was listening to some new
> records, and once I noticed that it was sounding good I gathered up some
> older stuff and threw it into the mix. A few records in, I realized that
> I was pitching things waaaay down to keep in step. Turns out the track I
> started things off with was about 120bpm! Anyway, give it a listen if
> that sounds interesting. Fans of so-called "heroin house", dub, and IDM
> will not want to miss this.
>=20
> Shazbot presents: Slow Down!
>=20
>=20
> 1. Booka Shade - Vertigo [Get Physical Music]
> 2. Pig & Dan - 24 Hour People [Submission]
> 3. Ricardo Villalobos - Bach to Back [Playhouse]
> 4. Estornel/Pucher - Ode To A Girl [Onitor]
> 5. Monne Automne - Automne [Lofi Stereo]
> 6. Echopilot - Deeper Function [Morris Audio Citysport Edition]
> 7. John Tejada & Arian Leviste - Ghetto Platypus [Palette]
> 8. Sunsetpeople - Mifune [Get Physical Music]
> 9. Eriko Tanabe - I Like To Wear My Tanga [Morris Audio]
> 10. John Tejada - Present Pretense [Tigersushi]
> 11. Nimbus - Nothing [Iron Box Music]
> 12. Ricardo Villalobos - 808 The Bass Queen [Lofi Stereo]
> 13. 2 Dollar Egg - Lync [i220]
>=20
> More on the way from the archives, and maybe a new mix this weekend if
> the weather stays crappy!
>=20
> Toodles,
> --=20
> shawn allen
>   mailto://shawn@alterior.net
>   phone://+1.415.577.3961
>   http://alterior.net
>   aim://shawnpallen
>=20
>=20
> ---------------------------------------------------------------------
> To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
> For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org
>=20

So I think I've probably already mentioned my Italo-disco side project to
some of you....

My electronic neo-disco band Easystreet is playing at Milk (1840 Haight @
Stanyan) this Thursday evening, and I would love to see some raver friends
there!  I play my blinky table of electronic boxes, and my partner Michael
Blitzen sings and dances and touches people.  Easystreet shows are generally
a very colorful and reasonably ridiculous affair.

You can hear some of Easystreet's joyfully dancing smile musics at
www.myspace.com/sexyeasystreet

We are on first, at approximately 8:30. Cover is $5.  There will be a smoke
machine.  Come come!!

Love Chelsea

------=_Part_3738_21170131.1203306899229--

> the freakin' AMAZING Fingrmonsters, is one of my favorite locals. This is a
> mix he posted way back in 2K5 that I saved. I highly reccommend streaming it
> or whatever....he has been doing what is popular in SF currently for YEARS
> now.

> ----------------------------------------
> > Date: Fri, 18 Mar 2005 23:01:52 -0800
> > From: shawn@alterior.net
> > To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
> > Subject: [sfraves] new (old) mix: Slow Down!
> >
> > So this thing has been languishing on my hard drive since last August. I
> > recently resurrected it from an old backup, and thought it was pretty
> > cool so I'm sharing it with you. Fair warning: this ain't no dance mix.
> > It's much better suited for zoning out at work, smoking something
> > illicit, recovering from a nasty hangover, or making out.
> >
> > The title refers to the fact that this is--by far--the slowest mix I've
> > ever done. I just hit record one day when I was listening to some new
> > records, and once I noticed that it was sounding good I gathered up some
> > older stuff and threw it into the mix. A few records in, I realized that
> > I was pitching things waaaay down to keep in step. Turns out the track I
> > started things off with was about 120bpm! Anyway, give it a listen if
> > that sounds interesting. Fans of so-called "heroin house", dub, and IDM
> > will not want to miss this.
> >
> > Shazbot presents: Slow Down!
> >
> >
> > 1. Booka Shade - Vertigo [Get Physical Music]
> > 2. Pig & Dan - 24 Hour People [Submission]
> > 3. Ricardo Villalobos - Bach to Back [Playhouse]
> > 4. Estornel/Pucher - Ode To A Girl [Onitor]
> > 5. Monne Automne - Automne [Lofi Stereo]
> > 6. Echopilot - Deeper Function [Morris Audio Citysport Edition]
> > 7. John Tejada & Arian Leviste - Ghetto Platypus [Palette]
> > 8. Sunsetpeople - Mifune [Get Physical Music]
> > 9. Eriko Tanabe - I Like To Wear My Tanga [Morris Audio]
> > 10. John Tejada - Present Pretense [Tigersushi]
> > 11. Nimbus - Nothing [Iron Box Music]
> > 12. Ricardo Villalobos - 808 The Bass Queen [Lofi Stereo]
> > 13. 2 Dollar Egg - Lync [i220]
> >
> > More on the way from the archives, and maybe a new mix this weekend if
> > the weather stays crappy!
> >
> > Toodles,
> > --
> > shawn allen
> >   mailto://shawn@alterior.net

Left Coast Techno and Transcend Present:
<<< I BLEED TECHNO >>>
Saturday March 15th, 2008

Featuring:

DDR (Stay Up Forever, Smitten, Triphazard.net) UK - 2 HOUR LIVE PA

A veteran of the London underground dance scene since 1990, DDR has =20
unleashed his own brand of techno-trance on many
labels and at many parties, raves, clubs & festivals around the globe. =20
A pioneer of what was to become the London Acid Techno
sound, DDR was the first guest producer to appear on Stay Up Forever =20
after a meeting of minds with the then newly created
Liberator DJ trio, he has had a hand in many of their most memorable =20
releases and is one of their most prolific artists to date.


ETHAN aka Ethan Miller (Friends and Family)
MEK & G.A.M.M.A. (Stilldream / Left Coast Techno)
COVERT (Transcend Events)
DISCONNECT (DEF / Bliss Factory)
CHEL-C FAITH (DEF / Bliss Factory) - LIVE PA

BAY AREA LOCATION!
Limited 150 Person event!
10pm-5am
18+ to enter
Entry: $10
More Info: 415.373.0181

Celebrating the Release of LEFT COAST TECHNO #1:

?Blackhole Burnout? ? By G.A.M.M.A. & Phokus, with Remixes by: Aaron =20
Liberator & The Geezer, and David Aaron & Psylence.
Buy it at the Show ? Don?t miss out on this long awaited release!

----- Original Message ----- 
From: 
To: 
Sent: Tuesday, February 19, 2008 4:03 PM
Subject: [sfraves] IBLEEDTECHNO - Saturday March 15th, 2008 - Bay Area 
Underground


Left Coast Techno and Transcend Present:
<<< I BLEED TECHNO >>>
Saturday March 15th, 2008

Featuring:

DDR (Stay Up Forever, Smitten, Triphazard.net) UK - 2 HOUR LIVE PA

A veteran of the London underground dance scene since 1990, DDR has
unleashed his own brand of techno-trance on many
labels and at many parties, raves, clubs & festivals around the globe.
A pioneer of what was to become the London Acid Techno
sound, DDR was the first guest producer to appear on Stay Up Forever
after a meeting of minds with the then newly created
Liberator DJ trio, he has had a hand in many of their most memorable
releases and is one of their most prolific artists to date.


ETHAN aka Ethan Miller (Friends and Family)
MEK & G.A.M.M.A. (Stilldream / Left Coast Techno)
COVERT (Transcend Events)
DISCONNECT (DEF / Bliss Factory)
CHEL-C FAITH (DEF / Bliss Factory) - LIVE PA

BAY AREA LOCATION!
Limited 150 Person event!
10pm-5am
18+ to enter
Entry: $10
More Info: 415.373.0181

Celebrating the Release of LEFT COAST TECHNO #1:

?Blackhole Burnout? ? By G.A.M.M.A. & Phokus, with Remixes by: Aaron
Liberator & The Geezer, and David Aaron & Psylence.
Buy it at the Show ? Don?t miss out on this long awaited release!

---------------------------------------------------------------------

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

----- Original Message ----- 
From: <gamma@techno-truth.com>

Subject: [sfraves] IBLEEDTECHNO - Saturday March 15th, 2008 - Bay Area 
Underground


Left Coast Techno and Transcend Present:
<<< I BLEED TECHNO >>>
Saturday March 15th, 2008

Featuring:

DDR (Stay Up Forever, Smitten, Triphazard.net) UK - 2 HOUR LIVE PA

A veteran of the London underground dance scene since 1990, DDR has
unleashed his own brand of techno-trance on many
labels and at many parties, raves, clubs & festivals around the globe.
A pioneer of what was to become the London Acid Techno
sound, DDR was the first guest producer to appear on Stay Up Forever
after a meeting of minds with the then newly created
Liberator DJ trio, he has had a hand in many of their most memorable
releases and is one of their most prolific artists to date.


ETHAN aka Ethan Miller (Friends and Family)
MEK & G.A.M.M.A. (Stilldream / Left Coast Techno)
COVERT (Transcend Events)
DISCONNECT (DEF / Bliss Factory)
CHEL-C FAITH (DEF / Bliss Factory) - LIVE PA

BAY AREA LOCATION!
Limited 150 Person event!
10pm-5am
18+ to enter
Entry: $10
More Info: 415.373.0181

Celebrating the Release of LEFT COAST TECHNO #1:

?Blackhole Burnout? ? By G.A.M.M.A. & Phokus, with Remixes by: Aaron
Liberator & The Geezer, and David Aaron & Psylence.
Buy it at the Show ? Don?t miss out on this long awaited release!

Tonight marks one year of Electronic Generation. I
thought it would be fitting to have the man who helped
start it all and my first guest one year ago... Justin
Hale.

It's been a fun journey this past year and I'm
thankful for all the guests that have been down to the
casa. I hope all of you have enjoyed the music as much
as I have.

Electronic Generation live on Stoutcast.com(Stoutcast
Radio)

Every Tuesday 
7:30 - 10 PST
10:30 - 1 EST

Justin Hale


Be sure to check www.djstevian.com for current guest
info and for Electronic Generation Podcasts!

show!

stevian

Just say no to Dubai.

"Customs officials found 0.003g of the drug - an amount that is invisible to 
the naked eye and weighs less than a grain of sugar - in his shoe. The youth 
development officer was sentenced to four years in prison."

http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/england/west_midlands/7235467.stm

"One Dubai law states that trace amounts of drugs used before coming to 
Dubai in the travelerâs system count as âdrug possession,â a crime punished 
with a four-year jail sentence. This includes legal, prescribed drugs for 
health conditions (examples include codeine and similar narcotic-like drugs 
prescribed for pain)."

http://thetruthaboutdubai.com/

See also: 
http://www.moh.gov.ae/moh_site/phar_med/price_list/controlled%20list.pdf

Peter

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: THURSDAY 2-21:  COMPRESSION: GROOVERIDER

February 21st 2008
Compression

Goldie (Metalheadz, UK)
In his own words:

Hey you blokes. My name is Goldie, and I represent that pure raw UK drum
and bass sound. My main goals in life include: making sick drum and bass
tracks that come off as crazy dance floor monsters (regardless if they all
sound the same), clipping mixers untill those red lights light up to the
top, destroying high end sound systems around the world, making peopls
eardrums explode, and trying to accomplish putting on all my gold
accessories in under 30 minutes time.

By 1991, Goldie had become fascinated by the British breakbeat music
scene; and his girlfriend, DJ Kemistry, introduced him to the pioneering
jungle/drum'n'bass producers Dennis 'Dego' McFarlane and Mark 'Marc Mac'
Clair, known as 4hero.  His first globally released album, Timeless,
followed in 1995. Timeless shot straight into the charts at number seven,
which was a first for a drum 'n' bass record.  In 2002, Goldie said that
he had been working for three years on a film called Sine Tempus,
described as a coming-of-age story of a young paintbrush artist, and in
2006 announced its soundtrack as his new album. As of 2008, album and film
have not been released yet.  Goldie is also known for his work as the
leader of the Rufige Kru. This group has no fixed members; it has included
some of most well-known drum and bass producers such as Technical Itch,
Heist, Teebee, Cujo, Agzilla Da Ice, Doc Scott and Rob Playford.

WITH SUPPORT FROM:
2Cents
4 Real
the Colonel MC

FEBRUARY 21, 2008
DOORS OPEN AT 10PM
$10 before 11pm, No Guestlist!

TEMPLE
55 Natoma (between Mission and Howard, between 1st and 2nd)

-- 
Take Care <3
Peace=->Jus' Me =-> O§bY {8O)

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: FRIDAY 2.22:EVIL BREAKS: DNA Lounge

Evil Breaks & False Profit present:
DIRTY

Friday, February 22nd, 2008
DNA Lounge (375 11th st.)

$10 presales available here:
(http://groovetickets.com/ordersystem/groove/eventviewqb.asp?AffilID=93&EventsID=36367&PGname=Evil%20Breaks)

$10 b4 11pm/$15 after that
10pm - 4am??
21+ w/ID


I know a bunch of people were expecting a show from us in January, but
instead of pushing forward with a show that just wasn't quite right, we
decided to move it to February. So here we are, coming at you with a show
that we KNOW will deliver. We're teaming up with False Profit for this
one, and along with the 2 UK headliners and a stellar local lineup, this
is really one you can't afford to miss.

AMB
(Chi-Recordings/Sinister/Money Shot/Audio Therapy/EQ) - UK

Based in London, but with roots in Hungarys Chi Recordings, Ambrus Deak
a.k.a. AMB, has been in music production, engineering, and label
management for over seven years.

Co-founder and a fundamental cog in Chi Recordings, he also appears on
Reacts 21st Century Breaks, Distinctives Y4K, EQ Recordings, and Dave
Saemans Audio Therapy. AMB was responsible for one of the most remarkable
breakbeat tracks of 2002, Romeo, which obtained second place on
Breakspoll, The International Breakbeat Awards, best single category in
2003. Support comes from Hybrid, Nick Warren, Roger Sanchez, James Zabiela
, Laurent Garnier, Elite Force, Chris Carter, Plump DJs, Terminalhead,
Meat Katie, Tayo, General Midi, Hyper, and many more. AMB is supported by
todays leading international provider of digital audio and MIDI
solutions, M-Audio. And when hes not making music or spinning records, he
puts on his mastering suit, or makes soundtracks for commercials, theatre
and the film industry.

As a DJ he has played in the USA, UK, France, Germany, Russia, Croatia,
Serbia, Hungary alongside The Chemical Brothers, Adam Freeland, Hybrid,
Chris Carter, Elite Force, General Midi, and a whole lot more.

Diverted
(Diverted Traffic/TCR/Sokolov Sounds/Mofo/ibreaks) - UK

DIVERTED are DJ/Producers and Label Owners Stephen Baxter and Lee
Richardson. They have produced a string of well received releases on
Sokolov Sounds, TCR and AIR which helped them find their grounding in the
breaks scene. This has also spurred the guys on to creating their album
which is being put together hand-in-hand with an exciting live show
involving vocalists, live instruments from the guys themselves and
contributions from other Djs and artists around them including Nine Lives
the Cat. Check out their myspace page for regular updates, videos, gig
schedule and news as this album takes shape.

The last year has taken them all around the world Djing their sound to the
masses. Particularly memorable nights have been at the infamous HUM
events, Drop Beats Not Bombs, Chew the Fat @ The End, Breakspoll @ Fabric,
Glade Festival and tours of Australia and Russia saw appreciation for the
boys outside the UK.

 Along with E.B. residents:
Carbon Community
(Sober Music/Bless Records/Moonshine/E.B.) - SF
Aaron Jae (E.B./Space Cowboys)
Bam (E.B./Invibe)
M.O.D. (E.B.)

False Profit upstairs:
Dr. Toast (FP)
Alxndr (Downlow/FP/Transported SF)
Obi-J (FP)
DJJD (FP)

Visuals by Dax
(Xenos Studios, Dax Presents)




-- 
Take Care <3
Peace=->Jus' Me =-> O§bY {8O)

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: Tonal's 1 Year Anniversary this Saturday!

One year ago we set out to put a new mark on the San Francisco scene with a
series of color themed parties by the name of Tonal that would feature our
favorite DJs from across the world.  After enlisting the help and input of
many of our friends and family, we decided to kick things off with what
turned into an insane underground featuring Q-Burns Abstract Message.  With
double the turnout we planned for and so many people dressed up in that
party's theme of Electric Blue, we knew we were on to something.

A full year later, looking back at what has been an epic run of events, we
decided it was time to bring back the blue theme for our One Year
Anniversary!  After a year that featured Justin Long and Shamrock Green,
Miles Maeda and Fire Engine Red, Matt e Starr and Pimpin' Purple, Troydon
and Poppin' Pink, Jay Tripwire and Groovin' Gold, Jeno and Fade to Black,
and finally Diz and Clockwork Orange, it's time for Midnight Blue with DJ
Fame!

Saturday, February 23rd

Rock It Science & Prismatic present

Tonal: Midnight Blue

Featuring:

DJ Fame (New York - Dubsided, Potty Mouth)

Tonal is very excited to welcome one of the most cutting edge DJ/producers
to emerge in recent years!  The only US artist with an EP on Dubsided, the
UK label which pioneered the fidget house sound, DJ Fame is coming live from
New York to tear our party to shreds!  From guest sets in every corner of
the globe, to his 4 year residency at New York's premier underground venue,
Sullivan Room, Fame has brought the more jackin' sounds of tech house and
electro to crowds of thousands across the world. A veteran with over a
decade on the decks, Fame's energetic performances showcase serious
technical ability combined with intense cuts, crazy loops, and other
turntablist tricks to bring a truly unique sound to the dance floor.

Plus:

Justin Martin (dirtybird, buzzin' fly)

Alland Byallo (kontrol, nightlight)

Leonard (tocadisco)

Andrew Phelan & Origami (prismatic, drop, amenti)

Eric Sharp (rock it science)

Jimmy B (green gorilla lounge, rxfx)

Rouzbeh (back2basics)

Bo (back2Basics, deep blue)

DK Watts & Lance Leber (short bus Kids, bounce house)

Native Intelligence (rock it science, sugar lounge)

Frankie Jr. (touch recordings, trusoul)

Kuze (nitewise)

Visuals by Viberation
Sound by Slide & Spin

10PM - Late
$10 before 11, $15 before 1, $20 after
For special discount and info text "prismatic" to 67463

Free mix CD for dressing up in Midnight Blue
SF location, for directions:
888-482-9281, 415-412-0406
www.prismatictracks.com

Subject: [sfraves] (nrr) QOD (Thu)

What do you guys think?  Quoting Adriana ... /discuss

--

I think it was the Great Depression and the New Deal, that broke the
connection of the American people with the Founding Fathers.  The
Founding Fathers had always taught that your own government is your
own worst enemy, it's the only one that can have real power over you.
Foreign invaders are not ever the threat of your own government, so
that's why they tied the government down with the Constitution, the
Bill of Rights, the seperation of powers and checks and balances and
all that.  And that was taught until the Great Depression, and then
Roosevelt came along and said that was all backwards, the government
is your protector, we're going to protect you, we're going to rescue
you, from the recession that the Federal Reserve caused.  And ever
since then, Americans have been taught to look to the government for
protection.

- Dr. Paul Craig Roberts, Alex Jones Show, August 29, 2007 2 h 36 m.

>> My electronic neo-disco band Easystreet is playing at Milk (1840  
>> Haight @
>> Stanyan) this Thursday evening, and I would love to see some raver  
>> friends
>> there!  I play my blinky table of electronic boxes, and my partner  
>> Michael
>> Blitzen sings and dances and touches people.  Easystreet shows are
>> generally
>> a very colorful and reasonably ridiculous affair.
>>
>> You can hear some of Easystreet's joyfully dancing smile musics at
>> www.myspace.com/sexyeasystreet
>>
>> We are on first, at approximately 8:30. Cover is $5.  There will be a
>> smoke
>> machine.  Come come!!
>>
>> Love Chelsea
>>
>>
>>
>>

Subject: [sfraves] bsp: Sat.Mar.1 // [KONTROL] w/ Derek Plaslaiko + Claude VonStroke

------=_Part_2232_14676922.1203712367126
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=WINDOWS-1252
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
Content-Disposition: inline

(some very hot FREE mixes below! read on...)
______________________________________



Saturday, March 1st, 2008


[ K O N T R O L ]


minimal techno + avant-house
every 1st Saturday @ The Endup



featuring from New York City:


DEREK PLASLAIKO  ( Spectral Sound . The Bunker )

Derek Plaslaiko doesn't make records, but he sure as hell
knows how to play 'em.  One of a select few to have made
a name for himself based on DJ skills alone, Derek's
dedication and immense musical knowledge, coupled with his
anything-goes attitude make every set a memorable dance
floor experience.  Once a prominent figure on the Detroit
party scene, he relocated to NYC a few years back and was
soon crowned "Best Techno DJ" by the Village Voice.  We
simply call him "The Man", and are excited to welcome him
back for an extended encore performance.



and San Francisco's own:


CLAUDE VONSTROKE  ( Mothership . Dirtybird )

The last time our friend Barclay Crenshaw played for us,
just a couple short years ago in August '05, it was one of
the first times his pseudonym Claude VonStroke had
appeared in print on a flyer.  My how times change!  Now a
bona fide international superstar synonymous with the new
sound of SF, the inimitable 'Stroker returns to [KONTROL]
to lay down a specially crafted techno set you won't hear
anywhere else.



with [KONTROL] residents:


CRAIG KUNA  ( Platform . ESDJCO )
ALLAND BYALLO  ( Leibe*Detail . Nightlight Music )
NIKOLA BAYTALA  ( Robsoul . S.W.A.T. )
SAMMY D  ( Dirtybird . Utensil )


________________________________________________


The ENDUP
401 6th St @ Harrison, SF
10pm - 6am / 21+ / $15
http://www.theendup.com

FREE until 11pm!

________________________________________________


Full bios, pics and FREE music:
http://www.kontrolsf.com

[KONTROL] on MySpace:
http://www.myspace.com/kontrolsf

Flyer:
http://www.kontrolsf.com/K33/K33H.jpg

Poster:
http://www.kontrolsf.com/K33/K33P.jpg


________________________________________________


DEREK PLASLAIKO

Some people filter through the record bins, taking what are on the wall or
record store employee suggestions. Then there are people who dig deeper int=
o
the dusty crates, and absorb music like a sponge; ignoring labels, bucking
trends, forever on a quest to find the perfect record. The ones that make
the staunchest of chin-stroking, note-taking trainspotters lose their shit
on the dancefloor, hanging on every record from one to the next.

Derek Plaslaiko unquestionably falls into the latter category. As a teen
equally transfixed by Mojo and Wizard cassettes and Minor Threat 7"s,
Plaslaiko followed the beats from his hometown 20 miles south of Detroit to
the epicenter of Detroit techno, then enjoying its third wave of success. H=
e
quietly paid his dues on Detroit's rave circuit, and was a crucial piece of
the puzzle for the legendary Poorboy and Syst3m parties of the mid-nineties=
.
He quickly earned a reputation for forward thinking DJ sets that were
clinical, sophisticated and extremely sensual. This combination resulted in
a residency for Family, the weekly party at Detroit's legendary Motor.  Wit=
h
a reputation for high energy sets that were versatile and tasteful,
Plaslaiko slowly became in demand on the Midwestern club circuit; sharing
the stage with such techno luminares as John Acquaviva, Kevin Saunderson,
Richardo Villalobos, Baby Ford, and Matthew Herbert. It was also during tha=
t
time Plaslaiko was asked by Carl Craig to perform at the inaugural edition
of the Detroit Electronic Music Festival.

In 2003, Plaslaiko became part of the original team of DJs at Detroit's
Untitled parties, sharing a residency with Tadd Mullinix (aka James T.
Cotton), Matthew Dear and Mike Servito. In 2004 he made the decision to hea=
d
east and set up camp in New York City, determined to bring a slice of the
Motor City to the Big Apple.  Currently, Derek is one of the resident DJs a=
t
the Bunker (Subtonic) in NYC, as well as an integral part of the Wolf + Lam=
b
monthly parties. More recently, he was honored in the Village Voice 2006's
"Best Of" poll as New York's Best Techno DJ.

The last time Derek played for [KONTROL] in February '07, he so thouroughly
impressed both the crowd and our resident DJs that we have been drooling
over the day we would have him back, and we're happy to report that day has
come. This time Derek comes to us as part of the "Death Is Nothing To Fear"
Spectral Residencies, on his first major US tour.

---> LINKS:

Derek's Website: (w/ lots of free sets for download)
http://plaslaiko.net

Derek on MySpace:
http://www.myspace.com/plaslaiko


---> AUDIO:

Live @ The Bunker, 2008 (Spectral Tour Kickoff - 5 hour set!)
http://feeds.feedburner.com/TheBunkerPodcast

Live @ Yura Yura, Philadelphia, 2006  (2 hours - 111MB)
http://www.kontrolsf.com/AUD/Derek_Plaslaiko_-_Live_@_Yura_Yura_-_Philadelp=
hia_07.15.06.mp3


---> VIDEO:

Live @ The Bunker, 2007 (Detroit Takeover night)
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3D6fvYgXJiNdM

Derek @ Mutek Igloofest 2008
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3Dsk8b1UbBQlY


________________________________________________


CLAUDE VONSTROKE

"I would like to come over=85what are you having for dinner?" asks the cree=
py
character in Claude VonStroke's first hit record, "Deep Throat."  After
selling through 10 pressings in 2005, "Deep Throat" quickly put VonStroke o=
n
the map as an up and coming artist.  The success of the single was followed
up by "Who's Afraid of Detroit?," another international hit championed by
Richie Hawtin who called it the "Best Track of 2006" in DJ magazine.  Soon
after he released his full length debut album, "Beware of the Bird" to
excellent reviews, further establishing him as an original talent in the
world of underground dance music. Since then, Claude has done remixes for a
very diverse group of top artists ranging all the way from indie-rock band
The Rapture, to electro legends Newcleus, to minimalists like Matt Tolfrey
and Jeff Samuel.

Claude VonStroke is better known to locals as Barclay Crenshaw, the owner o=
f
San Francisco's quirky tech-funk label, dirtybird.  The label consists of
Crenshaw (VonStroke,) friends and fellow producers Justin Martin, Christian
Martin, and Worthy, and a diverse assortment of top remixers from around th=
e
globe including John Tejada, Audion, Diplo, 3 Channels, Dj Assault, and
Kevin Saunderson.

The idea for dirtybird began in 2003 when Crenshaw was producing an intense
5 hour DVD about electronic music called, "Intellect." The project was a
labor of love, taking almost 2 years to complete and starring over 35 top
producers and legendary DJs such as Derrick May, Swayzak, Derrick Carter,
Deep Dish, Magda, Theo Parish, and many more.  The main goal of the
"Intellect" project was to make an informative DVD that could help DJs
advance their careers in electronic music. The result was Crenshaw himself
starting dirtybird records and a production career under the alias Claude
VonStroke.

Since 2005, dirtybird has managed to solidify a reputation for releasing
oddball classic techno and house tracks, and in the process has become one
of the hottest labels on the planet. The outdoor dirtybird parties in San
Francisco's scenic Golden Gate Park have also become a legendary summer
destination point for both locals and international travelers.

In addition to production and label management, Claude VonStroke has an
intense regimen for preparation and a great ear for song selection. His DJ
sets are always inspiring and surprising. You will never hear a set of
monotonous music because Claude always takes time to find the special cuts
that make for a completely original experience that is not to be missed.

In 2008, Claude is hard at work on his second album, in addition to
fostering his latest project, Mothership Records.  Mothership was started i=
n
2007 as VonStroke's outlet for deep and experimental techno. The first
record on Mothership became a summer classic and sold 7,000 vinyl records
and sat at #1 on the Beatport minimal techno chart for 8 weeks. Proceeds
from the label go towards children's music education in Claude's hometown o=
f
Detroit, Michigan.

Claude's special set for [KONTROL] will feature a deeper, darker techno sid=
e
of this fun-loving bear-shaped man!


---> LINKS:

Claude's Websites:
http://www.mothershipmusic.com
http://www.dirtybirdrecords.com

Claude's Discography:
http://www.discogs.com/artist/Claude%20VonStroke

Claude on MySpace:
www.myspace.com/claudevonstroke


---> AUDIO:

Claude VonStroke - At The Controls CD2 (320kbs)
***(NOTE: this whole CD, which shows off Claude's deeper, more
techno-oriented side, is made available in high quality and
FREE, as the company originally releasing it is now defunct!)
http://www.kontrolsf.com/AUD/CVS_At_The_Controls_CD2.mp3

Claude VonStroke - Mixmag Cover CD (320kbs)
http://www.dirtybirdrecords.com/audio/mixes/VONSTROKE_MIXMAG_CD.mp3

Claude's tracks on Beatport.com:
https://www.beatport.com/en-US/html/content/artist/detail/5430/claude_vonst=
roke

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3Dxmup8AofWnw

Official "Deep Throat" video:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3Dgg590RzMenk

Claude VonStroke - Live @ DEMF 2007
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3DytU8hYUnn_U
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3Dbb2t6U0m38Y

> Date: Fri, 22 Feb 2008 12:32:47 -0800
> From: bird415@gmail.com
> To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
> Subject: [sfraves] bsp: Sat.Mar.1 // [KONTROL] w/ Derek Plaslaiko + Claude 
> VonStroke
>
> (some very hot FREE mixes below! read on...)
> ______________________________________
>
>
>
> Saturday, March 1st, 2008
>
>
> [ K O N T R O L ]
>
>
> minimal techno + avant-house
> every 1st Saturday @ The Endup
>
>
>
> featuring from New York City:
>
>
> DEREK PLASLAIKO  ( Spectral Sound . The Bunker )
>
> Derek Plaslaiko doesn't make records, but he sure as hell
> knows how to play 'em.  One of a select few to have made
> a name for himself based on DJ skills alone, Derek's
> dedication and immense musical knowledge, coupled with his
> anything-goes attitude make every set a memorable dance
> floor experience.  Once a prominent figure on the Detroit
> party scene, he relocated to NYC a few years back and was
> soon crowned "Best Techno DJ" by the Village Voice.  We
> simply call him "The Man", and are excited to welcome him
> back for an extended encore performance.
>
>
>
> and San Francisco's own:
>
>
> CLAUDE VONSTROKE  ( Mothership . Dirtybird )
>
> The last time our friend Barclay Crenshaw played for us,
> just a couple short years ago in August '05, it was one of
> the first times his pseudonym Claude VonStroke had
> appeared in print on a flyer.  My how times change!  Now a
> bona fide international superstar synonymous with the new
> sound of SF, the inimitable 'Stroker returns to [KONTROL]
> to lay down a specially crafted techno set you won't hear
> anywhere else.
>
>
>
> with [KONTROL] residents:
>
>
> CRAIG KUNA  ( Platform . ESDJCO )
> ALLAND BYALLO  ( Leibe*Detail . Nightlight Music )
> NIKOLA BAYTALA  ( Robsoul . S.W.A.T. )
> SAMMY D  ( Dirtybird . Utensil )
>
>
> ________________________________________________
>
>
> The ENDUP
> 401 6th St @ Harrison, SF
> 10pm - 6am / 21+ / $15
> http://www.theendup.com
>
> FREE until 11pm!
>
> ________________________________________________
>
>
> Full bios, pics and FREE music:
> http://www.kontrolsf.com
>
> [KONTROL] on MySpace:
> http://www.myspace.com/kontrolsf
>
> Flyer:
> http://www.kontrolsf.com/K33/K33H.jpg
>
> Poster:
> http://www.kontrolsf.com/K33/K33P.jpg
>
>
> ________________________________________________
>
>
> DEREK PLASLAIKO
>
> Some people filter through the record bins, taking what are on the wall or
> record store employee suggestions. Then there are people who dig deeper 
> into
> the dusty crates, and absorb music like a sponge; ignoring labels, bucking
> trends, forever on a quest to find the perfect record. The ones that make
> the staunchest of chin-stroking, note-taking trainspotters lose their shit
> on the dancefloor, hanging on every record from one to the next.
>
> Derek Plaslaiko unquestionably falls into the latter category. As a teen
> equally transfixed by Mojo and Wizard cassettes and Minor Threat 7"s,
> Plaslaiko followed the beats from his hometown 20 miles south of Detroit 
> to
> the epicenter of Detroit techno, then enjoying its third wave of success. 
> He
> quietly paid his dues on Detroit's rave circuit, and was a crucial piece 
> of
> the puzzle for the legendary Poorboy and Syst3m parties of the 
> mid-nineties.
> He quickly earned a reputation for forward thinking DJ sets that were
> clinical, sophisticated and extremely sensual. This combination resulted 
> in
> a residency for Family, the weekly party at Detroit's legendary Motor. 
> With
> a reputation for high energy sets that were versatile and tasteful,
> Plaslaiko slowly became in demand on the Midwestern club circuit; sharing
> the stage with such techno luminares as John Acquaviva, Kevin Saunderson,
> Richardo Villalobos, Baby Ford, and Matthew Herbert. It was also during 
> that
> time Plaslaiko was asked by Carl Craig to perform at the inaugural edition
> of the Detroit Electronic Music Festival.
>
> In 2003, Plaslaiko became part of the original team of DJs at Detroit's
> Untitled parties, sharing a residency with Tadd Mullinix (aka James T.
> Cotton), Matthew Dear and Mike Servito. In 2004 he made the decision to 
> head
> east and set up camp in New York City, determined to bring a slice of the
> Motor City to the Big Apple.  Currently, Derek is one of the resident DJs 
> at
> the Bunker (Subtonic) in NYC, as well as an integral part of the Wolf + 
> Lamb
> monthly parties. More recently, he was honored in the Village Voice 2006's
> "Best Of" poll as New York's Best Techno DJ.
>
> The last time Derek played for [KONTROL] in February '07, he so 
> thouroughly
> impressed both the crowd and our resident DJs that we have been drooling
> over the day we would have him back, and we're happy to report that day 
> has
> come. This time Derek comes to us as part of the "Death Is Nothing To 
> Fear"
> Spectral Residencies, on his first major US tour.
>
> ---> LINKS:
>
> Derek's Website: (w/ lots of free sets for download)
> http://plaslaiko.net
>
> Derek on MySpace:
> http://www.myspace.com/plaslaiko
>
>
> ---> AUDIO:
>
> Live @ The Bunker, 2008 (Spectral Tour Kickoff - 5 hour set!)
> http://feeds.feedburner.com/TheBunkerPodcast
>
> Live @ Yura Yura, Philadelphia, 2006  (2 hours - 111MB)
> http://www.kontrolsf.com/AUD/Derek_Plaslaiko_-_Live_@_Yura_Yura_-_Philadelphia_07.15.06.mp3
>
>
> ---> VIDEO:
>
> Live @ The Bunker, 2007 (Detroit Takeover night)
> http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6fvYgXJiNdM
>
> Derek @ Mutek Igloofest 2008
> http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sk8b1UbBQlY
>
>
> ________________________________________________
>
>
> CLAUDE VONSTROKE
>
> "I would like to come overwhat are you having for dinner?" asks the 
> creepy
> character in Claude VonStroke's first hit record, "Deep Throat."  After
> selling through 10 pressings in 2005, "Deep Throat" quickly put VonStroke 
> on
> the map as an up and coming artist.  The success of the single was 
> followed
> up by "Who's Afraid of Detroit?," another international hit championed by
> Richie Hawtin who called it the "Best Track of 2006" in DJ magazine.  Soon
> after he released his full length debut album, "Beware of the Bird" to
> excellent reviews, further establishing him as an original talent in the
> world of underground dance music. Since then, Claude has done remixes for 
> a
> very diverse group of top artists ranging all the way from indie-rock band
> The Rapture, to electro legends Newcleus, to minimalists like Matt Tolfrey
> and Jeff Samuel.
>
> Claude VonStroke is better known to locals as Barclay Crenshaw, the owner 
> of
> San Francisco's quirky tech-funk label, dirtybird.  The label consists of
> Crenshaw (VonStroke,) friends and fellow producers Justin Martin, 
> Christian
> Martin, and Worthy, and a diverse assortment of top remixers from around 
> the
> globe including John Tejada, Audion, Diplo, 3 Channels, Dj Assault, and
> Kevin Saunderson.
>
> The idea for dirtybird began in 2003 when Crenshaw was producing an 
> intense
> 5 hour DVD about electronic music called, "Intellect." The project was a
> labor of love, taking almost 2 years to complete and starring over 35 top
> producers and legendary DJs such as Derrick May, Swayzak, Derrick Carter,
> Deep Dish, Magda, Theo Parish, and many more.  The main goal of the
> "Intellect" project was to make an informative DVD that could help DJs
> advance their careers in electronic music. The result was Crenshaw himself
> starting dirtybird records and a production career under the alias Claude
> VonStroke.
>
> Since 2005, dirtybird has managed to solidify a reputation for releasing
> oddball classic techno and house tracks, and in the process has become one
> of the hottest labels on the planet. The outdoor dirtybird parties in San
> Francisco's scenic Golden Gate Park have also become a legendary summer
> destination point for both locals and international travelers.
>
> In addition to production and label management, Claude VonStroke has an
> intense regimen for preparation and a great ear for song selection. His DJ
> sets are always inspiring and surprising. You will never hear a set of
> monotonous music because Claude always takes time to find the special cuts
> that make for a completely original experience that is not to be missed.
>
> In 2008, Claude is hard at work on his second album, in addition to
> fostering his latest project, Mothership Records.  Mothership was started 
> in
> 2007 as VonStroke's outlet for deep and experimental techno. The first
> record on Mothership became a summer classic and sold 7,000 vinyl records
> and sat at #1 on the Beatport minimal techno chart for 8 weeks. Proceeds
> from the label go towards children's music education in Claude's hometown 
> of
> Detroit, Michigan.
>
> Claude's special set for [KONTROL] will feature a deeper, darker techno 
> side
> of this fun-loving bear-shaped man!
>
>
> ---> LINKS:
>
> Claude's Websites:
> http://www.mothershipmusic.com
> http://www.dirtybirdrecords.com
>
> Claude's Discography:
> http://www.discogs.com/artist/Claude%20VonStroke
>
> Claude on MySpace:
> www.myspace.com/claudevonstroke
>
>
> ---> AUDIO:
>
> Claude VonStroke - At The Controls CD2 (320kbs)
> ***(NOTE: this whole CD, which shows off Claude's deeper, more
> techno-oriented side, is made available in high quality and
> FREE, as the company originally releasing it is now defunct!)
> http://www.kontrolsf.com/AUD/CVS_At_The_Controls_CD2.mp3
>
> Claude VonStroke - Mixmag Cover CD (320kbs)
> http://www.dirtybirdrecords.com/audio/mixes/VONSTROKE_MIXMAG_CD.mp3
>
> Claude's tracks on Beatport.com:
> https://www.beatport.com/en-US/html/content/artist/detail/5430/claude_vonstroke
>
>
> ---> VIDEO:
>
> Official "Who's Afraid of Detroit?" video:
> http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xmup8AofWnw
>
> Official "Deep Throat" video:
> http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gg590RzMenk
>
> Claude VonStroke - Live @ DEMF 2007
> http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ytU8hYUnn_U
> http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bb2t6U0m38Y

----- Original Message ----
From: Greg Bird <bird415@gmail.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Sent: Friday, February 22, 2008 12:32:47 PM
Subject: [sfraves] bsp: Sat.Mar.1 // [KONTROL] w/ Derek Plaslaiko + Claude 
VonStroke

(some very hot FREE mixes below! read on...)
______________________________________



Saturday, March 1st, 2008


[ K O N T R O L ]


minimal techno + avant-house
every 1st Saturday @ The Endup



featuring from New York City:


DEREK PLASLAIKO  ( Spectral Sound . The Bunker )

Derek Plaslaiko doesn't make records, but he sure as hell
knows how to play 'em.  One of a select few to have made
a name for himself based on DJ skills alone, Derek's
dedication and immense musical knowledge, coupled with his
anything-goes attitude make every set a memorable dance
floor experience.  Once a prominent figure on the Detroit
party scene, he relocated to NYC a few years back and was
soon crowned "Best Techno DJ" by the Village Voice.  We
simply call him "The Man", and are excited to welcome him
back for an extended encore performance.



and San Francisco's own:


CLAUDE VONSTROKE  ( Mothership . Dirtybird )

The last time our friend Barclay Crenshaw played for us,
just a couple short years ago in August '05, it was one of
the first times his pseudonym Claude VonStroke had
appeared in print on a flyer.  My how times change!  Now a
bona fide international superstar synonymous with the new
sound of SF, the inimitable 'Stroker returns to [KONTROL]
to lay down a specially crafted techno set you won't hear
anywhere else.



with [KONTROL] residents:


CRAIG KUNA  ( Platform . ESDJCO )
ALLAND BYALLO  ( Leibe*Detail . Nightlight Music )
NIKOLA BAYTALA  ( Robsoul . S.W.A.T. )
SAMMY D  ( Dirtybird . Utensil )


________________________________________________


The ENDUP
401 6th St @ Harrison, SF
10pm - 6am / 21+ / $15
http://www.theendup.com

FREE until 11pm!

________________________________________________


Full bios, pics and FREE music:
http://www.kontrolsf.com

[KONTROL] on MySpace:
http://www.myspace.com/kontrolsf

Flyer:
http://www.kontrolsf.com/K33/K33H.jpg

Poster:
http://www.kontrolsf.com/K33/K33P.jpg


________________________________________________


DEREK PLASLAIKO

Some people filter through the record bins, taking what are on the wall or
record store employee suggestions. Then there are people who dig deeper into
the dusty crates, and absorb music like a sponge; ignoring labels, bucking
trends, forever on a quest to find the perfect record. The ones that make
the staunchest of chin-stroking, note-taking trainspotters lose their shit
on the dancefloor, hanging on every record from one to the next.

Derek Plaslaiko unquestionably falls into the latter category. As a teen
equally transfixed by Mojo and Wizard cassettes and Minor Threat 7"s,
Plaslaiko followed the beats from his hometown 20 miles south of Detroit to
the epicenter of Detroit techno, then enjoying its third wave of success. He
quietly paid his dues on Detroit's rave circuit, and was a crucial piece of
the puzzle for the legendary Poorboy and Syst3m parties of the mid-nineties.
He quickly earned a reputation for forward thinking DJ sets that were
clinical, sophisticated and extremely sensual. This combination resulted in
a residency for Family, the weekly party at Detroit's legendary Motor.  With
a reputation for high energy sets that were versatile and tasteful,
Plaslaiko slowly became in demand on the Midwestern club circuit; sharing
the stage with such techno luminares as John Acquaviva, Kevin Saunderson,
Richardo Villalobos, Baby Ford, and Matthew Herbert. It was also during that
time Plaslaiko was asked by Carl Craig to perform at the inaugural edition
of the Detroit Electronic Music Festival.

In 2003, Plaslaiko became part of the original team of DJs at Detroit's
Untitled parties, sharing a residency with Tadd Mullinix (aka James T.
Cotton), Matthew Dear and Mike Servito. In 2004 he made the decision to head
east and set up camp in New York City, determined to bring a slice of the
Motor City to the Big Apple.  Currently, Derek is one of the resident DJs at
the Bunker (Subtonic) in NYC, as well as an integral part of the Wolf + Lamb
monthly parties. More recently, he was honored in the Village Voice 2006's
"Best Of" poll as New York's Best Techno DJ.

The last time Derek played for [KONTROL] in February '07, he so thouroughly
impressed both the crowd and our resident DJs that we have been drooling
over the day we would have him back, and we're happy to report that day has
come. This time Derek comes to us as part of the "Death Is Nothing To Fear"
Spectral Residencies, on his first major US tour.

---> LINKS:

Derek's Website: (w/ lots of free sets for download)
http://plaslaiko.net

Derek on MySpace:
http://www.myspace.com/plaslaiko


---> AUDIO:

Live @ The Bunker, 2008 (Spectral Tour Kickoff - 5 hour set!)
http://feeds.feedburner.com/TheBunkerPodcast

Live @ Yura Yura, Philadelphia, 2006  (2 hours - 111MB)
http://www.kontrolsf.com/AUD/Derek_Plaslaiko_-_Live_@_Yura_Yura_-_Philadelphia_07.15.06.mp3


---> VIDEO:

Live @ The Bunker, 2007 (Detroit Takeover night)
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6fvYgXJiNdM

Derek @ Mutek Igloofest 2008
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sk8b1UbBQlY


________________________________________________


CLAUDE VONSTROKE

"I would like to come overâ¦what are you having for dinner?" asks the creepy
character in Claude VonStroke's first hit record, "Deep Throat."  After
selling through 10 pressings in 2005, "Deep Throat" quickly put VonStroke on
the map as an up and coming artist.  The success of the single was followed
up by "Who's Afraid of Detroit?," another international hit championed by
Richie Hawtin who called it the "Best Track of 2006" in DJ magazine.  Soon
after he released his full length debut album, "Beware of the Bird" to
excellent reviews, further establishing him as an original talent in the
world of underground dance music. Since then, Claude has done remixes for a
very diverse group of top artists ranging all the way from indie-rock band
The Rapture, to electro legends Newcleus, to minimalists like Matt Tolfrey
and Jeff Samuel.

Claude VonStroke is better known to locals as Barclay Crenshaw, the owner of
San Francisco's quirky tech-funk label, dirtybird.  The label consists of
Crenshaw (VonStroke,) friends and fellow producers Justin Martin, Christian
Martin, and Worthy, and a diverse assortment of top remixers from around the
globe including John Tejada, Audion, Diplo, 3 Channels, Dj Assault, and
Kevin Saunderson.

The idea for dirtybird began in 2003 when Crenshaw was producing an intense
5 hour DVD about electronic music called, "Intellect." The project was a
labor of love, taking almost 2 years to complete and starring over 35 top
producers and legendary DJs such as Derrick May, Swayzak, Derrick Carter,
Deep Dish, Magda, Theo Parish, and many more.  The main goal of the
"Intellect" project was to make an informative DVD that could help DJs
advance their careers in electronic music. The result was Crenshaw himself
starting dirtybird records and a production career under the alias Claude
VonStroke.

Since 2005, dirtybird has managed to solidify a reputation for releasing
oddball classic techno and house tracks, and in the process has become one
of the hottest labels on the planet. The outdoor dirtybird parties in San
Francisco's scenic Golden Gate Park have also become a legendary summer
destination point for both locals and international travelers.

In addition to production and label management, Claude VonStroke has an
intense regimen for preparation and a great ear for song selection. His DJ
sets are always inspiring and surprising. You will never hear a set of
monotonous music because Claude always takes time to find the special cuts
that make for a completely original experience that is not to be missed.

In 2008, Claude is hard at work on his second album, in addition to
fostering his latest project, Mothership Records.  Mothership was started in
2007 as VonStroke's outlet for deep and experimental techno. The first
record on Mothership became a summer classic and sold 7,000 vinyl records
and sat at #1 on the Beatport minimal techno chart for 8 weeks. Proceeds
from the label go towards children's music education in Claude's hometown of
Detroit, Michigan.

Claude's special set for [KONTROL] will feature a deeper, darker techno side
of this fun-loving bear-shaped man!


---> LINKS:

Claude's Websites:
http://www.mothershipmusic.com
http://www.dirtybirdrecords.com

Claude's Discography:
http://www.discogs.com/artist/Claude%20VonStroke

Claude on MySpace:
www.myspace.com/claudevonstroke


---> AUDIO:

techno-oriented side, is made available in high quality and
FREE, as the company originally releasing it is now defunct!)
http://www.kontrolsf.com/AUD/CVS_At_The_Controls_CD2.mp3

______________________________________



Saturday, March 1st, 2008


[ K O N T R O L ]


minimal techno + avant-house
every 1st Saturday @ The Endup



featuring from New York City:


DEREK PLASLAIKO  ( Spectral Sound . The Bunker )

Derek Plaslaiko doesn't make records, but he sure as hell
knows how to play 'em.  One of a select few to have made
a name for himself based on DJ skills alone, Derek's
dedication and immense musical knowledge, coupled with his
anything-goes attitude make every set a memorable dance
floor experience.  Once a prominent figure on the Detroit
party scene, he relocated to NYC a few years back and was
soon crowned "Best Techno DJ" by the Village Voice.  We
simply call him "The Man", and are excited to welcome him
back for an extended encore performance.



and San Francisco's own:


CLAUDE VONSTROKE  ( Mothership . Dirtybird )

The last time our friend Barclay Crenshaw played for us,
just a couple short years ago in August '05, it was one of
the first times his pseudonym Claude VonStroke had
appeared in print on a flyer.  My how times change!  Now a
bona fide international superstar synonymous with the new
sound of SF, the inimitable 'Stroker returns to [KONTROL]
to lay down a specially crafted techno set you won't hear
anywhere else.



with [KONTROL] residents:


CRAIG KUNA  ( Platform . ESDJCO )
ALLAND BYALLO  ( Leibe*Detail . Nightlight Music )
NIKOLA BAYTALA  ( Robsoul . S.W.A.T. )
SAMMY D  ( Dirtybird . Utensil )

401 6th St @ Harrison, SF
10pm - 6am / 21+ / $15
http://www.theendup.com

FREE until 11pm!

________________________________________________


DEREK PLASLAIKO

Some people filter through the record bins, taking what are on the wall or
record store employee suggestions. Then there are people who dig deeper into
the dusty crates, and absorb music like a sponge; ignoring labels, bucking
trends, forever on a quest to find the perfect record. The ones that make
the staunchest of chin-stroking, note-taking trainspotters lose their shit
on the dancefloor, hanging on every record from one to the next.

Derek Plaslaiko unquestionably falls into the latter category. As a teen
equally transfixed by Mojo and Wizard cassettes and Minor Threat 7"s,
Plaslaiko followed the beats from his hometown 20 miles south of Detroit to
the epicenter of Detroit techno, then enjoying its third wave of success. He
quietly paid his dues on Detroit's rave circuit, and was a crucial piece of
the puzzle for the legendary Poorboy and Syst3m parties of the mid-nineties.
He quickly earned a reputation for forward thinking DJ sets that were
clinical, sophisticated and extremely sensual. This combination resulted in
a residency for Family, the weekly party at Detroit's legendary Motor.  With
a reputation for high energy sets that were versatile and tasteful,
Plaslaiko slowly became in demand on the Midwestern club circuit; sharing
the stage with such techno luminares as John Acquaviva, Kevin Saunderson,
Richardo Villalobos, Baby Ford, and Matthew Herbert. It was also during that
time Plaslaiko was asked by Carl Craig to perform at the inaugural edition
of the Detroit Electronic Music Festival.

In 2003, Plaslaiko became part of the original team of DJs at Detroit's
Untitled parties, sharing a residency with Tadd Mullinix (aka James T.
Cotton), Matthew Dear and Mike Servito. In 2004 he made the decision to head
east and set up camp in New York City, determined to bring a slice of the
Motor City to the Big Apple.  Currently, Derek is one of the resident DJs at
the Bunker (Subtonic) in NYC, as well as an integral part of the Wolf + Lamb
monthly parties. More recently, he was honored in the Village Voice 2006's
"Best Of" poll as New York's Best Techno DJ.

The last time Derek played for [KONTROL] in February '07, he so thouroughly
impressed both the crowd and our resident DJs that we have been drooling
over the day we would have him back, and we're happy to report that day has
come. This time Derek comes to us as part of the "Death Is Nothing To Fear"
Spectral Residencies, on his first major US tour.

---> LINKS:

Derek's Website: (w/ lots of free sets for download)
http://plaslaiko.net

Derek on MySpace:
http://www.myspace.com/plaslaiko

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sk8b1UbBQlY


________________________________________________


CLAUDE VONSTROKE

"I would like to come overâ¦what are you having for dinner?" asks the creepy
character in Claude VonStroke's first hit record, "Deep Throat."  After
selling through 10 pressings in 2005, "Deep Throat" quickly put VonStroke on
the map as an up and coming artist.  The success of the single was followed
up by "Who's Afraid of Detroit?," another international hit championed by
Richie Hawtin who called it the "Best Track of 2006" in DJ magazine.  Soon
after he released his full length debut album, "Beware of the Bird" to
excellent reviews, further establishing him as an original talent in the
world of underground dance music. Since then, Claude has done remixes for a
very diverse group of top artists ranging all the way from indie-rock band
The Rapture, to electro legends Newcleus, to minimalists like Matt Tolfrey
and Jeff Samuel.

Claude VonStroke is better known to locals as Barclay Crenshaw, the owner of
San Francisco's quirky tech-funk label, dirtybird.  The label consists of
Crenshaw (VonStroke,) friends and fellow producers Justin Martin, Christian
Martin, and Worthy, and a diverse assortment of top remixers from around the
globe including John Tejada, Audion, Diplo, 3 Channels, Dj Assault, and
Kevin Saunderson.

The idea for dirtybird began in 2003 when Crenshaw was producing an intense
5 hour DVD about electronic music called, "Intellect." The project was a
labor of love, taking almost 2 years to complete and starring over 35 top
producers and legendary DJs such as Derrick May, Swayzak, Derrick Carter,
Deep Dish, Magda, Theo Parish, and many more.  The main goal of the
"Intellect" project was to make an informative DVD that could help DJs
advance their careers in electronic music. The result was Crenshaw himself
starting dirtybird records and a production career under the alias Claude
VonStroke.

Since 2005, dirtybird has managed to solidify a reputation for releasing
oddball classic techno and house tracks, and in the process has become one
of the hottest labels on the planet. The outdoor dirtybird parties in San
Francisco's scenic Golden Gate Park have also become a legendary summer
destination point for both locals and international travelers.

In addition to production and label management, Claude VonStroke has an
intense regimen for preparation and a great ear for song selection. His DJ
sets are always inspiring and surprising. You will never hear a set of
monotonous music because Claude always takes time to find the special cuts
that make for a completely original experience that is not to be missed.

In 2008, Claude is hard at work on his second album, in addition to
fostering his latest project, Mothership Records.  Mothership was started in
2007 as VonStroke's outlet for deep and experimental techno. The first
record on Mothership became a summer classic and sold 7,000 vinyl records
and sat at #1 on the Beatport minimal techno chart for 8 weeks. Proceeds
from the label go towards children's music education in Claude's hometown of
Detroit, Michigan.

Claude's special set for [KONTROL] will feature a deeper, darker techno side
of this fun-loving bear-shaped man!


---> LINKS:

Claude's Websites:
http://www.mothershipmusic.com
http://www.dirtybirdrecords.com

Claude's Discography:
http://www.discogs.com/artist/Claude%20VonStroke

Claude on MySpace:
www.myspace.com/claudevonstroke

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: Tonight!! ILL-ECTRO NIGHT ON DEF's RADIO INTEGRATED: PSB

This week /// 22 February, 2008 /// 9pm-1am Pacific Standard Time /// 
http://radio.defsf.com:1200/ <http://www.zer01.net:1200/>

Ok so electro has been always this misunderstood genre.. where people 
automatically do a bad impression of a broken robot, or worse, think its 
something that Benni Benassi made up. Yet, has anybody really 
investigated how super sick and awesome true electro really is?! Well, I 
know at least a few people who have, and so tonight I have the pleasure 
to bring you two super fresh djs that are bringing the goods! Tonight on 
radio integrated its ILL-ECTRO night with the sounds of:

DJS:

->INDIGO

Indigo first got into electro when he was 8 years old - it happened 
during the scene in the movie 'Breakin' where Turbo is dancing to 
Kraftwerk's 'Tour de France' ( incidentally this scene was stolen from 
fred astaire)- and was instantly hooked.

Philip aka Dj Indigo started spinning in 1994 when he lived in the same 
neighborhood in San Jose as the Harmony kids. He would hang out in 
Jeremy's garage, and they would get too stoned, leaving the decks open 
for him to play. The setup was a pair of belt-drive turntables from the 
Goodwill store.  A stalwart young DJ Indigo would have these crappy 
decks all to himself while the harmony kids on the couch across the room 
and ate their junk food from the 7-eleven down the street. Whenever 
Indigo would trainwreck, they would groan and throw things at him. Thus, 
young DJ's mixing skills improved pretty quickly in that environment. 
once Indigo finally got himself a pair of 1200's, he couldn't believe 
how easy it was to beatmatch on them.

Early influences were DJ Dan, the Wicked Full Moon parties, Galen, and 
Sabin

crews: Urban Wasteland, Friends & Family

photo:  http://farm2.static.flickr.com/1178/1403685737_22577f49c1.jpg
mix:  http://waxdj.com/djs/5635/

&

->SHEZTEK


Tom Shez Lee (aka ShezTek) has been spinning and
collecting for over 12 years. He is a classically
trained violinist and pianist and grew up attending
magnet schools for music in Miami, FL. While at school
at MIT (Cambridge, MA), he began to be exposed to EDM
music and the community it fostered. It wasn't soon
after that he wanted to give back to that community
and started DJing and helping throw some parties. His
musical tastes are easy to pick out since he grew up
in Miami with the sounds of Miami Bass, Electro and
Freestyle.


crews: Moksha tribe and Evil Breaks

http://www.myspace.com/sheztek 





Tune in at :
http://radio.defsf.com:1200/
or
http://www.zer01.net:1200/

Every Friday from 9pm - 1AM PST

Contact : radiointegrated@gmail.com <mailto:radiointegrated@gmail.com>


Upcoming Radio Integrated shows ///

*29 February// Broadcasting live from brand new techno weekly Faktion at 
Anu in San Francisco, with DJ Developer (Los Angeles) and local SF deep 
techno producer Endosine (Live P.A.) Come in and have a drink with us at 
Anu if you're in town, otherwise tune in to Radio Integrated and be 
there in spirit. ;)

*7 March//  Keeping it real with DJs Clarity and Caltrop. Clarity is a 
longtime SF techno favorite who played some records at the very first 
DEF event, and we are stoked to welcome her back. A former resident of 
SF electro club Tokyo Electric, Caltrop is an eclectic and creative DJ 
who always keeps it groovin' with his mix of minimal, electro, house, 
disco, acid, from the old school to the new school.

More coming soon in march!

Check it out!


For updates on Radio Integrated, DEF, and San Francisco Bay Area techno 
news and info, sign up for the DEF list at 
def-announce-subscribe@defsf.com 
<mailto:def-announce-unsubscribe@defsf.com>

----- Original Message ----
From: Sean Ocean <seanocean@defsf.com>
To: def-announce@defsf.com; the land of LALA <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Sent: Friday, February 22, 2008 3:54:32 PM
Subject: [sfraves] BSP: Tonight!! ILL-ECTRO NIGHT ON DEF's RADIO INTEGRATED: PSB

This week /// 22 February, 2008 /// 9pm-1am Pacific Standard Time /// 
http://radio.defsf.com:1200/ <http://www.zer01.net:1200/>

Ok so electro has been always this misunderstood genre.. where people 
automatically do a bad impression of a broken robot, or worse, think its 
something that Benni Benassi made up. Yet, has anybody really 
investigated how super sick and awesome true electro really is?! Well, I 
know at least a few people who have, and so tonight I have the pleasure 
to bring you two super fresh djs that are bringing the goods! Tonight on 
radio integrated its ILL-ECTRO night with the sounds of:

DJS:

->INDIGO

Indigo first got into electro when he was 8 years old - it happened 
during the scene in the movie 'Breakin' where Turbo is dancing to 
Kraftwerk's 'Tour de France' ( incidentally this scene was stolen from 
fred astaire)- and was instantly hooked.

Philip aka Dj Indigo started spinning in 1994 when he lived in the same 
neighborhood in San Jose as the Harmony kids. He would hang out in 
Jeremy's garage, and they would get too stoned, leaving the decks open 
for him to play. The setup was a pair of belt-drive turntables from the 
Goodwill store.  A stalwart young DJ Indigo would have these crappy 
decks all to himself while the harmony kids on the couch across the room 
and ate their junk food from the 7-eleven down the street. Whenever 
Indigo would trainwreck, they would groan and throw things at him. Thus, 
young DJ's mixing skills improved pretty quickly in that environment. 
once Indigo finally got himself a pair of 1200's, he couldn't believe 
how easy it was to beatmatch on them.

Early influences were DJ Dan, the Wicked Full Moon parties, Galen, and 
Sabin

crews: Urban Wasteland, Friends & Family

photo:  http://farm2.static.flickr.com/1178/1403685737_22577f49c1.jpg
mix:  http://waxdj.com/djs/5635/

&

->SHEZTEK


Tom Shez Lee (aka ShezTek) has been spinning and
collecting for over 12 years. He is a classically
trained violinist and pianist and grew up attending
magnet schools for music in Miami, FL. While at school
at MIT (Cambridge, MA), he began to be exposed to EDM
music and the community it fostered. It wasn't soon
after that he wanted to give back to that community
and started DJing and helping throw some parties. His
musical tastes are easy to pick out since he grew up
in Miami with the sounds of Miami Bass, Electro and
Freestyle.


crews: Moksha tribe and Evil Breaks

http://www.myspace.com/sheztek 





Tune in at :
http://radio.defsf.com:1200/
or
http://www.zer01.net:1200/

Every Friday from 9pm - 1AM PST

Contact : radiointegrated@gmail.com <mailto:radiointegrated@gmail.com>


Upcoming Radio Integrated shows ///

*29 February// Broadcasting live from brand new techno weekly Faktion at 
Anu in San Francisco, with DJ Developer (Los Angeles) and local SF deep 
techno producer Endosine (Live P.A.) Come in and have a drink with us at 
Anu if you're in town, otherwise tune in to Radio Integrated and be 
there in spirit. ;)

*7 March//  Keeping it real with DJs Clarity and Caltrop. Clarity is a 
longtime SF techno favorite who played some records at the very first 
DEF event, and we are stoked to welcome her back. A former resident of 
SF electro club Tokyo Electric, Caltrop is an eclectic and creative DJ 
who always keeps it groovin' with his mix of minimal, electro, house, 
disco, acid, from the old school to the new school.

More coming soon in march!

Check it out!

news and info, sign up for the DEF list at

Haha... Yeah, it was a little short, we were cut off a bit early so the next
band could play while their friends still had the patience to stick around.

Man oh man... playing for normals who come to hear their friend's rock band
is challenging! Phew! So far we've only played shows for freaks who were
really into it, so this was kind of an interesting experience for us. The
crowd was almost entirely made up of friends of the second band. Is that
what little rock shows are like?  I've been a raver for so long, I kinda
don't remember.  I really enjoy playing for ravers at real parties much more
(or at least places where people are on drugs, jeez!).  Raver kids are way
more into the glowsticks and spray glitter anyway.   ;)

--CH

This week /// 22 February, 2008 /// 9pm-1am Pacific Standard Time ///
http://radio.defsf.com:1200/
<http://www.zer01.net:1200/><http://www.zer01.net:1200/>

Ok so electro has been always this misunderstood genre.. where people
automatically do a bad impression of a broken robot, or worse, think its
something that Benni Benassi made up. Yet, has anybody really investigated
how super sick and awesome true electro really is?! Well, I know at least a
few people who have, and so tonight I have the pleasure to bring you two
super fresh djs that are bringing the goods! Tonight on radio integrated its
ILL-ECTRO night with the sounds of:

DJS:

->INDIGO

Indigo first got into electro when he was 8 years old - it happened during
the scene in the movie 'Breakin' where Turbo is dancing to Kraftwerk's 'Tour
de France' ( incidentally this scene was stolen from fred astaire)- and was
instantly hooked.

Philip aka DJ Indigo started spinning in 1994 when he lived in the same
neighborhood in San Jose as the Harmony kids. He would hang out in Jeremy's
garage, and they would get too stoned, leaving the decks open for him to
play. The setup was a pair of belt-drive turntables from the Goodwill
store.  A stalwart young DJ Indigo would have these crappy decks all to
himself while the harmony kids on the couch across the room and ate their
junk food from the 7-eleven down the street. Whenever Indigo would
trainwreck, they would groan and throw things at him. Thus, young DJ's
mixing skills improved pretty quickly in that environment. once Indigo
finally got himself a pair of 1200's, he couldn't believe how easy it was to
beatmatch on them.

Early influences were DJ Dan, the Wicked Full Moon parties, Galen, and Sabin


crews: Urban Wasteland, Friends & Family

photo:  http://farm2.static.flickr.com/1178/1403685737_22577f49c1.jpg
mix:  http://waxdj.com/djs/5635/

&

->SHEZTEK


Tom Shez Lee (aka ShezTek) has been spinning and
collecting for over 12 years. He is a classically
trained violinist and pianist and grew up attending
magnet schools for music in Miami, FL. While at school
at MIT (Cambridge, MA), he began to be exposed to EDM
music and the community it fostered. It wasn't soon
after that he wanted to give back to that community
and started DJing and helping throw some parties. His
musical tastes are easy to pick out since he grew up
in Miami with the sounds of Miami Bass, Electro and
Freestyle.


crews: Moksha tribe and Evil Breaks

http://www.myspace.com/sheztek




Tune in at :
http://radio.defsf.com:1200/
or
http://www.zer01.net:1200/

Every Friday from 9pm - 1AM PST

----- Original Message ----
From: Sean Ocean <seanocean@defsf.com>
To: def-announce@defsf.com; the land of LALA <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Sent: Friday, February 22, 2008 3:54:32 PM
Subject: [sfraves] BSP: Tonight!! ILL-ECTRO NIGHT ON DEF's RADIO INTEGRATED: PSB

This week /// 22 February, 2008 /// 9pm-1am Pacific Standard Time /// 
http://radio.defsf.com:1200/ <http://www.zer01.net:1200/>

Ok so electro has been always this misunderstood genre.. where people 
automatically do a bad impression of a broken robot, or worse, think its 
something that Benni Benassi made up. Yet, has anybody really 
investigated how super sick and awesome true electro really is?! Well, I 
know at least a few people who have, and so tonight I have the pleasure 
to bring you two super fresh djs that are bringing the goods! Tonight on 
radio integrated its ILL-ECTRO night with the sounds of:

DJS:

->INDIGO

Indigo first got into electro when he was 8 years old - it happened 
during the scene in the movie 'Breakin' where Turbo is dancing to 
Kraftwerk's 'Tour de France' ( incidentally this scene was stolen from 
fred astaire)- and was instantly hooked.

Philip aka Dj Indigo started spinning in 1994 when he lived in the same 
neighborhood in San Jose as the Harmony kids. He would hang out in 
Jeremy's garage, and they would get too stoned, leaving the decks open 
for him to play. The setup was a pair of belt-drive turntables from the 
Goodwill store.  A stalwart young DJ Indigo would have these crappy 
decks all to himself while the harmony kids on the couch across the room 
and ate their junk food from the 7-eleven down the street. Whenever 
Indigo would trainwreck, they would groan and throw things at him. Thus, 
young DJ's mixing skills improved pretty quickly in that environment. 
once Indigo finally got himself a pair of 1200's, he couldn't believe 
how easy it was to beatmatch on them.

Early influences were DJ Dan, the Wicked Full Moon parties, Galen, and 
Sabin

crews: Urban Wasteland, Friends & Family

photo:  http://farm2.static.flickr.com/1178/1403685737_22577f49c1.jpg
mix:  http://waxdj.com/djs/5635/

&

->SHEZTEK


Tom Shez Lee (aka ShezTek) has been spinning and
collecting for over 12 years. He is a classically
trained violinist and pianist and grew up attending
magnet schools for music in Miami, FL. While at school
at MIT (Cambridge, MA), he began to be exposed to EDM
music and the community it fostered. It wasn't soon
after that he wanted to give back to that community
and started DJing and helping throw some parties. His
musical tastes are easy to pick out since he grew up
in Miami with the sounds of Miami Bass, Electro and
Freestyle.


crews: Moksha tribe and Evil Breaks

http://www.myspace.com/sheztek 





Tune in at :
http://radio.defsf.com:1200/
or
http://www.zer01.net:1200/

Every Friday from 9pm - 1AM PST

Contact : radiointegrated@gmail.com <mailto:radiointegrated@gmail.com>


Upcoming Radio Integrated shows ///

*29 February// Broadcasting live from brand new techno weekly Faktion at 
Anu in San Francisco, with DJ Developer (Los Angeles) and local SF deep 
techno producer Endosine (Live P.A.) Come in and have a drink with us at 
Anu if you're in town, otherwise tune in to Radio Integrated and be 
there in spirit. ;)

*7 March//  Keeping it real with DJs Clarity and Caltrop. Clarity is a 
longtime SF techno favorite who played some records at the very first 
DEF event, and we are stoked to welcome her back. A former resident of 
SF electro club Tokyo Electric, Caltrop is an eclectic and creative DJ 
who always keeps it groovin' with his mix of minimal, electro, house, 
disco, acid, from the old school to the new school.

More coming soon in march!

Check it out!


For updates on Radio Integrated, DEF, and San Francisco Bay Area techno 
news and info, sign up for the DEF list at 
def-announce-subscribe@defsf.com 
<mailto:def-announce-unsubscribe@defsf.com>


///Radio Integrated :: radiointegrated@gmail.com 
<mailto:radiointegrated@gmail.com> :: http://www.zer01.net:1200/ :: 
Broadcasting live from Bliss Factory Studios, Alameda, CA///

> Radio Integrated is now on the air (8pm Pacific Standard Time)!  
> Right now we're playing some electro tunes selected by me, soon to  
> be followed by electro sets by DJs Indigo and Sheztek starting at 9pm.
>
> Tune in at http://radio.defsf.com:1200/ to check it out!
>

> * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *  
> * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *
>
>
> This week /// 22 February, 2008 /// 9pm-1am Pacific Standard  
> Time /// http://radio.defsf.com:1200/ <http://www.zer01.net:1200/>
>
> Ok so electro has been always this misunderstood genre.. where  
> people automatically do a bad impression of a broken robot, or  
> worse, think its something that Benni Benassi made up. Yet, has  
> anybody really investigated how super sick and awesome true electro  
> really is?! Well, I know at least a few people who have, and so  
> tonight I have the pleasure to bring you two super fresh djs that  
> are bringing the goods! Tonight on radio integrated its ILL-ECTRO  
> night with the sounds of:
>
> DJS:
>
> ->INDIGO
>
> Indigo first got into electro when he was 8 years old - it happened  
> during the scene in the movie 'Breakin' where Turbo is dancing to  
> Kraftwerk's 'Tour de France' ( incidentally this scene was stolen  
> from fred astaire)- and was instantly hooked.
>
> Philip aka DJ Indigo started spinning in 1994 when he lived in the  
> same neighborhood in San Jose as the Harmony kids. He would hang out  
> in Jeremy's garage, and they would get too stoned, leaving the decks  
> open for him to play. The setup was a pair of belt-drive turntables  
> from the Goodwill store.  A stalwart young DJ Indigo would have  
> these crappy decks all to himself while the harmony kids on the  
> couch across the room and ate their junk food from the 7-eleven down  
> the street. Whenever Indigo would trainwreck, they would groan and  
> throw things at him. Thus, young DJ's mixing skills improved pretty  
> quickly in that environment. once Indigo finally got himself a pair  
> of 1200's, he couldn't believe how easy it was to beatmatch on them.
>
> Early influences were DJ Dan, the Wicked Full Moon parties, Galen,  
> and Sabin
>
> crews: Urban Wasteland, Friends & Family
>
> photo:  http://farm2.static.flickr.com/1178/1403685737_22577f49c1.jpg
> mix:  http://waxdj.com/djs/5635/
>
> &
>
> ->SHEZTEK
>
>
> Tom Shez Lee (aka ShezTek) has been spinning and
> collecting for over 12 years. He is a classically
> trained violinist and pianist and grew up attending
> magnet schools for music in Miami, FL. While at school
> at MIT (Cambridge, MA), he began to be exposed to EDM
> music and the community it fostered. It wasn't soon
> after that he wanted to give back to that community
> and started DJing and helping throw some parties. His
> musical tastes are easy to pick out since he grew up
> in Miami with the sounds of Miami Bass, Electro and
> Freestyle.
>
>
> crews: Moksha tribe and Evil Breaks
>
> http://www.myspace.com/sheztek
>
>
>
>
> Tune in at :
> http://radio.defsf.com:1200/
> or
> http://www.zer01.net:1200/
>
> Every Friday from 9pm - 1AM PST
>
> Contact : radiointegrated@gmail.com
>
>
> Upcoming Radio Integrated shows ///
>
> *29 February// Broadcasting live from brand new techno weekly  
> Faktion at Anu in San Francisco, with DJ Developer (Los Angeles) and  
> local SF deep techno producer Endosine (Live P.A.) Come in and have  
> a drink with us at Anu if you're in town, otherwise tune in to Radio  
> Integrated and be there in spirit. ;)
>
> *7 March//  Keeping it real with DJs Clarity and Caltrop. Clarity is  
> a longtime SF techno favorite who played some records at the very  
> first DEF event, and we are stoked to welcome her back. A former  
> resident of SF electro club Tokyo Electric, Caltrop is an eclectic  
> and creative DJ who always keeps it groovin' with his mix of  
> minimal, electro, house, disco, acid, from the old school to the new  
> school.
>
> More coming soon in march!
